trans-unit.target: TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_SEQ_00<tab>An urgent order has come in, and Rral Soj needs your help to see it completed.

TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_SEQ_01<tab>Rral Soj has tasked you with crafting lightweight lanterns for a Pelupelu peddler.
※Minimum collectability rating for this delivery is 230. Delivering items with a rating of 470 or more will earn greater rewards.

TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_SEQ_02<tab>You deliver the lightweight lanterns to Rral Soj. The peddler arrives before long to pick them up, and is thrilled to see her urgent order was completed in so short a time. Unfortunately, however, Papawni seems to have fallen into a slump, failing to craft even a single lantern. Exasperated, Rral Soj pleads with Papawni to pick up her pace, but this only seems to push the former potsworn beyond her breaking point, causing her to flee back to Earthenshire. Rral Soj appears shocked by her employee's sudden departure, and will no doubt need some comforting words once she has had time to process her emotions.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_TODO_00<tab>Deliver the lightweight lanterns to Rral Soj.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_000<tab>If speed is such a priority, then... No, I mustn't think like that.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_010<tab>You're just the person I wanted to see, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. An urgent order's come in.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_011<tab>Our client this time's a travelin' Pelupelu peddler, who needs as many lightweight lanterns as we can make before she departs the city.

TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_012<tab>While she'll use a number o' the lanterns herself during her travels, I understand she intends to sell the majority o' 'em to folk back home. I'll need you both workin' at a brisk pace today.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_013<tab>Y-Yes ma'am! Erm, will the lanterns be used on alpacaback? Or will they be carried by hand?
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_014<tab>I-It's just that depending on how the lanterns will be used, their intensity, size, and practicality ought to be considered...
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_015<tab>A slave to the minutiae as ever. Very well, I'll instruct you as we work.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_016<tab>Do you not wish to hear these details as well, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>?
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_A1_000_001<tab>I've spent some time with the Pelupelu, and have a grasp of their needs.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_A1_000_002<tab>Nay. I need only my intuition!

TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_017<tab>Oh, I had no idea... I've seen little of the world for myself, so my outlook is probably narrower than most. Mayhap that is why it takes me so long to understand the needs of our patrons.

TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_018<tab>J-Just by your intuition alone!? Amazing... I've always had the desired materials and product laid out before me by someone else, so perhaps that is why I never developed such a sense. How liberating it must feel to act by your wits alone...
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_019<tab>Maybe I should... No, no, this isn't the time. I must concentrate on completing the task set before me first...
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_020<tab>I'll help her get started. In the meantime, I need you preppin' those lanterns as soon as able. If you can craft at least six, we should be in the clear.

TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_030<tab>If the lanterns are to be used for travel, they must be not only lightweight, but durable as well. Which materials would be best suited to accomplish such a feat...? Think, Papawni, think!
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_040<tab>The client will be departin' before long, but I know I can count on you to have those lanterns ready.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_050<tab>Fine work, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. One would have no trouble trekkin' through even the darkest forest with this.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_051<tab>Fantastic work, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. One would have no trouble treadin' even the most poorly kept roads at night with this.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_060<tab>All ready to set off, then?
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PELUPELUWOMAN04971_000_061<tab>I am. I'll take whatever lanterns you were able to prepare.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_062<tab>Not a problem. It so happens <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var> here just finished craftin' a selection I daresay you'll be quite pleased with.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PELUPELUWOMAN04971_000_063<tab>Splendid. Simply splendid. My thanks for preparing these in so short a time.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_064<tab>Of course. For a merchant like yourself, time is money. I'm pleased we were able to be o' service.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PELUPELUWOMAN04971_000_065<tab>Oh, the pleasure has been all mine. Now, I'd best be setting off. I wish you all continued success.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_066<tab>Once again, I can't thank you enough for your aid, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. We truly couldn't have done this without you.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_067<tab>No doubt Papawni understands this most keenly. She failed to craft even a single lantern, after all.
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_068<tab>I told you this was an urgent request. Surely you can imagine what might befall a merchant travelin' without a lantern?
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_069<tab>Damn it Papawni, you know my code! Never, ever, keep a customer waitin'! If you want to work here, then I'm beggin' you─pick up the pace!
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_070<tab><sob> I... I'm so sorry!
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_071<tab>I'm not like <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>... I can't make something of quality at the speed you require...
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_072<tab>Y-Yet I also cannot simply forsake all else for speed. I want the things I make to be just right for the people who use them!
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_073<tab>On my dignity as a former potsworn, and as an artisan, this is the one thing I cannot yield! I...I never should have come here!
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_PAPAWNI_000_074<tab>I will return to Earthenshire, and renew my contract with the Moblins!
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_075<tab>Papawni, wait!
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_076<tab>Moblins...? Potsworn...? What was she talkin' about?
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_077<tab><sigh> I'm sorry you had to see that, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>.

TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_RRALSOJ_000_078<tab>I'm still gettin' used to this whole business o' bein' an employer. I fear my inexperience may be to blame for settin' Papawni off like that. Give me a minute to process this, would you?
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_SYSTEM_000_090<tab>Rral Soj is overjoyed with your efforts. She now considers you a <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Metal Miracle Worker<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var>!
TEXT_KINGLA104_04971_SYSTEM_000_091<tab>A new quest continuing the story of XRral Soj Metalwares is now available. Upon its completion, the Wachumeqimeqi Deliveries list for Rral Soj will be updated.
